revised_title: Revisiting Nucleation Rates and Particle Growth Kinetics: The Birth and Death Process
tldr: This article explores the birth and death process in particle growth, specifically in colloidal systems. The author introduces a modified model that accounts for reversible chemical reactions at the particle-atmosphere interface, leading to a better understanding of nucleation kinetics and particle growth. The study also discusses the implications of the birth and death process on the distribution of particle sizes and the role of evaporation and condensation rates in achieving stable chemical equilibrium.
